description:
Using XML to do requests I tried to create an server with an associated keypair using 'key_name' attribute as used in the json version in tempest.

Although the 'key_name' attribute is ignored during the server creation and no key is associated.
title: Cannot create a server associated with a keypair throuhg XML API

comments.content:
Using XML to do requests I tried to create an server with an associated keypair using 'key_name' attribute as used in the json version in tempest.

Although the 'key_name' attribute is ignored during the server creation and no key is associated.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~maurosr

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/11668
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/11668
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/bb94747da49ba35aca8a4a431e89c26c60d41cd9
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit bb94747da49ba35aca8a4a431e89c26c60d41cd9
Author: Mauro S. M. Rodrigues <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Aug 20 12:49:17 2012 -0400

    Add key_name attribute in XML servers API
    
    Fixes bug 1039139
    
    The API was ignoring the 'key_name' attribute and so it was impossible to
    create a server associated with a keypair. This patch fix the issue.
    
    Change-Id: I1efe542081382f3a19b31c09ddfc93929b1485d0
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
